column5: Good day today as the pup got his first pheasants Hope to hunt all next week and also try and squeeze some river time in. Anyone else been out? R
Nice man! Looks like a good time with the pup! I haven't been out, but I don't hunt either! I keep saying I need to take it up...
Never pheasant hunt before.... sounds like fun..... congrats Rustic-Fisher thanks for sharing Leechman
Good stuff!! I've never shot a pheasant! I've been getting the odd duck though  S.
That's a real beauty of a pup.  Tell us about him (her).  How old?  Did you do the training yourself?  Were you pleased with the breeder you bought the dog from?  Why'd you choose a GSP?

Pup is seven months old and was brought up from the States. I could not have asked for a better breeder after being burned last year by one    doing all the training myself with the help of some buddys that hunt GSPs and a healthy population of wild birds 2 min from home. As for picking that breed, I needed a dog that was high strong and full of energy and willing to go all day, ease of training, and an all round versatile dog that preformed well in a variety conditions. The GSP being the meat and potatoes of the pointy breeds I choose it.
Nice birds. Looks like you spend some time in the gym too.
Lol I have to , between chasing my son around and wrangling the dog I need all the help I can get!!
Noice birds!  Someone call a plumber..  Those pipes are about to burst..
Went out a few weekends ago for some partridge, we flushed a few but didn't get any shots. Of course on the way out we saw half a dozen sitting on the road.
Yep, been there before. I swear they do that on purpose!
